p: Soybean plants are presumed to be native to northeastern China and were not widely distributed, except in China and Japan, until 1890, even after their introduction in Europe. Soybean can easily be mass produced, and the soybean plant is considered to be one of the principal plants that can solve world hunger [ 1]. Soybean contains low amounts of saturated fat and is a great source of high-quality protein, dietary fiber, and isoflavone, which makes it unique among other legumes [ 2].
